New Records: Rohit Sharma scored the fastest 92 against Australia in T20Is, reaching the milestone in 41 deliveries
Key Match Events: Australia lost a crucial Super Eights clash to India by 24 runs
Travis Head scored 76, but Australia's hopes faded when he was dismissed
Mitch Marsh offered hope of a captain's knock with 37 from 28 balls
Glenn Maxwell also threatened to provide Head the support he needed when he struck 15 off his first four balls
Rohit Sharma was named the Player of the Match for his brilliant 92 off 41 deliveries
Jasprit Bumrah took a good catch at short third man to dismiss Tim David
Kuldeep Yadav got the big fish, removing Glenn Maxwell with a googly
Marcus Stoinis perished after a reverse sweep, hitting it straight to Hardik Pandya at backward point
Travis Head continued to torment India, slamming Kuldeep over long off for another maximum
Pre-Game Insights: Australia were always on the back foot at Daren Sammy Stadium
India captain Rohit Sharma was named the Player of the Match after scoring 92 off just 41 deliveries
Rohit took charge when he helped crunch 29 runs from the third over of the game off Mitchell Starc
Post-Match Reflections: Australian captain Mitch Marsh spoke on what he called a 'disappointing' loss for his side
Marsh said Australia backed themselves to chase down the score when Glenn Maxwell and Travis Head were together in the middle
Rohit Sharma said it was 'quite satisfying' especially when you play like that, and that India played well and kept doing the things they know best
Miscellaneous Highlights: India won by 24 runs, which means Australia will now hope Afghanistan loses later today against Bangladesh
If Afghanistan loses, Australia will qualify for the semi-finals, albeit unconvincingly
India goes 3-0 in the Super Eights to book a semi-final date against England
Others: The result means the undefeated India qualify for the semi-finals and will face England
Australia's hopes of being world champions in all formats are in grave danger
